H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3556.def: = celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3097.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Zeruiah<SDBH:צְרוּיָה>}, sister of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}; ► chief of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}'s army

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H4487.def: = action with which one determines or estimates the number of a collection of persons, objects, or events

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H7110.def: = process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H3083.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gersom<SDBH:גֵּרְשֹׁום>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► Levite assisting {L:Micah<SDBH:מִיכָיְהוּ>} and later the {L:Danites<SDBH:דָּנִי>} as {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}

H5818.def: = man, also known as {L:Azariah<SDBH:עֲזַרְיָה>}; ◄ son of {L:Amaziah<SDBH:אֲמַצְיָהוּ>}; tribe of Judah; ► father of {L:Jotham<SDBH:יֹותָם>}; king of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}, but became leprous after he burned incense in the temple

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3723.def: = collection of dwellings, not surrounded by a wall

H4026.def: = relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

H5836.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Chelub<SDBH:כְּלוּב>}; ► official; time of king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H3620.def: = relatively large container ◄ made woven material such as grass or reeds; ► used for storing fruit, but also by hunters to store birds that they have caught

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4399.def: = an activity involving a physical effort and usually requiring a certain amount of training or skill

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H2067.def: = man, also known as {L:Zimri<SDBH:זִמְרִי>}; ◄ son of {L:Zerah<SDBH:זֶרַח>}; tribe of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► ancestor of {L:Achan<SDBH:עָכָן>}

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H2132.def: = tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈  regarded as beautiful and associated with well-being

H8256.def: = a tree up to 10 m high with large low, spreading branches; its fruit grows in bunches on the trunk and branches of the tree rather than among the leaves; ◄ Ficus sycomorus; ► its fruit is edible but not as juicy or sweet as the more common variety of fig; ≈ image of something plentiful

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H8219.def: literally: the lowland; = the area situated between the {L:hill-country<SDBH:הַר>} and the coastal plain, which consists of foothills; named thus by the Israelites who occupied the hill-country; known for its {L:olive trees<SDBH:זַיִת>} and {L:sycamore trees<SDBH:שִׁקְמָה>}

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H8289.def: = plain; ◄ along the coast of the Mediterranean

H8202.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Hori<SDBH:חֹרִי>}; tribe of {L:Simeon<SDBH:שִׁמְעֹון>}; ► one of the twelve men sent by {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>} to spy out the land

H5724.def: = man; ► father of {L:Shaphat<SDBH:שָׁפָט>}, official, time of king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H179.def: = man; ► official in charge of the camels; time of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H3459.def: = person regarded as descendant of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>}, son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>}

H1581.def: = large quadruped mammal, which may reach a height of 2 m. or more; dromedaries are bigger and a uniform light fawn color; bactrians are darker; they are suited to life in desert areas, store excess food in their humps, can go without water for long periods, and can make long journeys through dry areas; ◄ Camelus dromedarius and Camelus bactrianus; ► they are used for riding and for carrying heavy loads and pulling carts; their hair is woven into cloth used for making tents or outer robes; their milk is used as food and drink; ≈ they are a symbol of wealth and commerce, but unclean and not to be eaten

H3165.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shubael<SDBH:שׁוּבָאֵל>}; ► Levite; time of king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H860.def: = large, strong, female {L:donkey<SDBH:חֲמֹור>} ► used for riding

H1905.def: = member of ethnic group living east of {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>}; ◄ possibly regarded as descendants of {L:Hagar<SDBH:הָגָר>}; ► conquered by {L:Saul<SDBH:שָׁאוּל>}

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1730.def: = person for whom one has great affection, often accompanied by sexual desire

H3083.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gersom<SDBH:גֵּרְשֹׁום>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► Levite assisting {L:Micah<SDBH:מִיכָיְהוּ>} and later the {L:Danites<SDBH:דָּנִי>} as {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H2453.def: = man; ► father of {L:Jashobeam<SDBH:יָשָׁבְעָם>}, warrior, time of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H757.def: = member of clan; ◄ part of tribe of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3077.def: = man; ► father of {L:Benaiah<SDBH:בְּנָיָהוּ>}, warrior, later army commander of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}

H54.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ahimelech<SDBH:אֲחִימֶלֶךְ>}; ► {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; time of king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}

H3097.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Zeruiah<SDBH:צְרוּיָה>}, sister of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}; ► chief of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}'s army

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor
